title: Stone Block
summaries: The Stone Block is a type of block that is generated naturally in very large parts of the world. The majority of the Underground and Cavern layers is comprised of Stone Blocks. As a crafting ingredient, they are vital early in the game to craft the Furnace and Wooden Arrows.

After <linked>Hardmode</linked> is activated in a world, nearby <linked>Corrupt</linked>, <linked>Crimson</linked>, and <linked>Hallowed</linked> blocks can spread through Stone Blocks, changing them into <linked>Ebonstone</linked>, <linked>Crimstone</linked>, or <linked>Pearlstone</linked>, respectively. Ebonstone and Crimstone Blocks can be returned to normal with <linked>Purification Powder</linked>, whereas Pearlstone Blocks require <linked>Vile</linked> or <linked>Vicious</linked> Powders. All three types can also be transformed back into regular Stone Blocks with the <linked>Green Solution</linked>.
Stone Blocks can be found with moss growing on them, and it can be placed on them manually. Gemcorns(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) can only be planted on Stone Blocks.

Rock Golems(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and gem trees(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) drop Stone Blocks, making them a renewable source of Stone Blocks. On the [img:Old-gen console version] Old-gen console version and Nintendo 3DS[img:Nintendo 3DS version] version, Stone Blocks are non-renewable.
